page.title: 04FORTRIE FARMING
page.content:
{Farming}is very important in{Fortrie. We mostly have{sheep}and{cattle.}Most farms grow{grain, turnips}and{potatoes {Lambs}are born in spring but can come in late winter or early summer.{Sheep are{sheared}in spring and{dipped}in July and September to kill off{maggots and{ticks.}In summer we harvest the {hay}and{silage}for the{livestock.}At the end of summer we cut our{peas, harvest{barley}and{wheat}and{bale}the {straw.}The{stubble}is the part that is not used and it is burned. In early winter the{winter barley}is sown and the{cattle}taken inside.
*ELAINE COOPER* *~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~*
